column4: hello the hibernation option is not available in the power menu
hello the hibernation option is not available in the power menu
Did you configure your partitions manually?
Can you check to see what size your swap partition is?
i dont need swap i have 4gb ram
Swap is required for hibernation
That's where the memory is dumped
how do i create one?
You will have UUIDs for other partitions as well. If you already have one that says swap, then you're fine.
You will need to use GParted with a live CD, then setup the line in fstab and reconfigure uswsusp
how do i setup the line in fstab and fixing the uswsusp?
My fstab swap line looks like this: UUID=a54dda5e-c297-4db3-a49e-f1af66685cd3 none            swap    sw              0       0
where do i find this?
You need to put a line it /etc/fstab that looks just like that, but with your own swap's UUID, which you can get by typing "blkid" in a terminal
i have a UUID line there
You should have a swap partition by default if you let Ubuntu manage the partition setup
i have only one for the /dev/sdb1
So nothing with "swap" in it?
no
You will need to make one on a livecd with GParted then.
how big to do the swap partition
If you want to hibernate, make it the size of your ram.
as big as the RAM size?
Yup
